title: How to find the equations of the tangents from the origin to the circle x^2 + y^2 - 10x - 6y + 25 = 0 - Quora

response.answer_text: Equation of a line through origin is [math]y=mx[/math] A tangent must have only one point of intersection with the circle. Plugging [math]y=mx[/math] in the given equation, [math](1+m^2)x^2-(6m+10)x+25=0[/math] For identical roots of this equation [math](6m+10)^2=4*(1+m^2)*25[/math] Simplifying [math]8m^2–15m=0[/math] [math]m(8m-15)=0[/math] [math]m=[/math]0 or [math]m=\dfrac {15}8[/math] So the two tangents are [math]y=0[/math] and [math]8y=15x[/math] EDIT after 2 years I had forgotten the problem and Philip Lloyd’s comment today triggered a new idea int my head. Center[math] C=95,30[/math] and [math]R=\sqrt {5^2+3^2–25}=3.[/math] This means [math]x[/math] axis ia a tangent. If[math] \theta [/math]is the angle made y [math]O[/math]A with [math]x [/math]axis, [math]\tan \theta=\dfrac 3 5.[/math] Definitely the other tangent make[math]s \angle 2 \theta[/math] with [math]x[/math] axis. [math]\tan 2\theta=\dfrac {2\tan \theta}{1-\tan^2 \theta}=\dfrac {2\times \frac 3 5 }{1-\frac 9{25}}=\dfrac  {15}8[/math] hence the other tangent is [math]y=\dfrac {15x}8[/math] If this is a better solution, I am getting wiser over last 2 years.

Equation of circle is given [math]x^2+y^2-10x-6y+25=0[/math] [math]\text{Centre of circle}(\dfrac{1}{2}×\text{ coefficient of x},\dfrac{1}{2}×\text{ coefficient of y}) [/math] [math]\text{Centre of circle(5,3) }[/math] [math]\text{Radius}=\sqrt{5^2+3^2–25}[/math] [math]\text{Radius}=3[/math] Now it show radius is same as the y coordinate of centre. So it means circle lies in first quadrant and touches the x-axis. It has two tangent from the origin one the x-axis itself. Here have to find the equation of 2nd tangent. Both tangent are passing from origin. Let suppose equation of tangents. [math]y=mx [/math] Or [math]mx-y=0[/math] This tangent touch the circle at unique point. And its distance from the centre (5,3) of circle is 3 cm( radius of circle. [math]3=\left|\dfrac{5m-3}{\sqrt{m^2+1}}\right|[/math] Squaring both side [math]9(m^2+1)=(5m-3)^2[/math] [math]9m^2+9=25m^2+9–30m[/math] [math]25m^2–9m^2–30m=0[/math] [math]16m^2–30m=0[/math] [math]2m(8m-15)=0[/math] [math]m=0,\,\dfrac{15}{8}[/math] m=0 represent the x-axis. Equation of tangent [math](y-0)=\dfrac{15}{8}(x-0)[/math] [math]8y=15x[/math] [math]15x-8y=0[/math] Let if want to find the point of contact. Its also so easy. Let the tangent touch the circle at (h,k). Slope of tangent [math]\dfrac{k}{h}=\dfrac{15}{8}.....(1)[/math] This tangent is perpendicular to radius of circle at point of contact. So slope of normal to tangent is -8/15. [math]\dfrac{k-3}{h-5}=\dfrac{-8}{15}....(2)[/math] Solving equation (1) and (2) [math]k=\dfrac{75}{17}[/math] [math]h=\dfrac{40}{17}[/math]
